bddtester.core.bdd

Class Feature

  • java.lang.Object
    • bddtester.core.bdd.Feature
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Statusable

    public class Feature
extends java.lang.Object
implements Statusable
    Represents a feature in the BDD Hierarchy.
    Therefore, this is the entry point for every test.
    Author:
    ckeiner

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ReportInterface reporter
      The class responsible for reporting.

      Executes the feature.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Feature

        public Feature(java.lang.String description,
               java.util.List<Before> befores,
               java.util.List<After> afters,
               java.util.List<AbstractScenario> scenarios)
        Creates a Feature with the specified description, scenarios, backgrounds and post steps.
        Parameters:
        description - String that describes the Feature.
        befores - The list of Befores to execute before each scenario.
        afters - The list of Afters to execute after each scenario.
        scenarios - List of AbstractScenarios that the feature should execute.

    • Method Detail

      • test

        public void test()
        Executes the feature.
        Every exception and error is bundled and thrown in a FeatureException or FeatureError respectively.
        Should both, an exception and an error, occur, a FeatureException is thrown.

      • executeScenario

        public void executeScenario(AbstractScenario scenario)
        Executes the specified scenario.
        Parameters:
        scenario - The AbstractScenario that should be executed.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()

      • getScenarios

        public java.util.List<AbstractScenario> getScenarios()
        Returns all scenarios.
        Returns:
        Returns all AbstractScenario of this feature.
